definition: to fly to the moon
to go to/to head for/towards
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
moon/month/monthly/CL:個|个[ge4],輪|轮[lun2]

sentences.english: Halfway to the moon, the astronauts broadcast a color television program to Earth.
sentences.chinese: 奔月途中，宇航員們向地球播放了一段彩色電視節目。

sentences.english: Then you will see the moon shot.
sentences.chinese: 屆時，你會看到那一“奔月”的壯舉。

sentences.english: This may be the fundamental reason for "Goddess flying to the Moon" changing to the toad.
sentences.chinese: 這就是“嫦娥奔月”後變爲“蟾蜍”的根本原因。

sentences.english: Many people often say that from the Mid-Autumn Moon story.
sentences.chinese: 通常有許多人講，中秋節源自嫦娥奔月的故事。

sentences.english: Have you heard tales of change?
sentences.chinese: 你聽過嫦娥奔月的傳說嗎？

sentences.english: The ancient legend about Changer's flying to the moon is known by all the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 嫦娥奔月的古老傳說就在中國家喻戶曉。

sentences.english: The legend Chang Er Flying to the Moon is a beautiful fable of ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 嫦娥奔月的傳說是中國古代一個美麗的神話故事。

sentences.english: When Ho busy firing, stealing Goose herself.
sentences.chinese: 后羿忙射日，嫦娥偷奔月。

sentences.english: Chang E Flying to the Moon is one of the four main Chinese myths.
sentences.chinese: 嫦娥奔月神話是中國的四大神話之一。

sentences.english: The traditional food of Mid-Autumn Festival is moon cake.
sentences.chinese: 大家都知道嫦娥奔月的故事，但爲啥中秋喫月餅？

definition: Chang'e, the lady in the moon (Chinese mythology)/one of the Chang'e series of PRC lunar spacecraft
see 嫦娥[Chang2 e2]
the Jade Hare/the moon
flying Apsara (Buddhist art)
Cowherd and Weaving maid (characters in folk story)/separated lovers/Altair and Vega (stars)
Palace in the Moon (in folk tales)
lit. mythical bird Jingwei tries to fill the ocean with stones (idiom); futile ambition/task of Sisyphus/determination in the face of impossible odds
a beautiful woman/graceful and elegant posture/moon
Vega (star)/Weaving girl of folk tales
Xi Wangmu, Queen Mother of the West, keeper of the peaches of immortality/popularly known as 王母娘娘
(literary) paternal grandmother
another name for 西王母[Xi1 wang2 mu3], Queen Mother of the West
another name for Xi Wangmu 西王母, Queen Mother of the West
to fly on a crane/to die
to become immortal/big promotion/die
to die/to fly on a crane
Nichang, abbr. for the Tang Dynasty song "Raiment of Rainbows and Feathers" 霓裳羽衣曲[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 qu1] or 霓裳羽衣舞[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 wu3]
nichang, rainbow colored clothes worn by the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
